text: Hey Jane, just wanted to say thanks again for coming with me to the Haven of Hope meeting last night. It really means a lot to have your support. It's been a challenging journey since I was diagnosed with HIV.
I'm feeling a bit anxious about the upcoming appointment, but I'm trying to stay positive. The uncertainty of how my body will continue to respond to the treatment is always on my mind.
It's been a tough week with the medication side effects, but talking to you always helps.
Good morning, Jane. I had a rough night but I'm looking forward to our chat later. See you at Haven of Hope? I'm still processing the news of my HIV status.
I got the results back, and it's confirmed. I'm starting treatment next week. I'm glad you're by my side. It's been a sobering experience facing this reality.
Thanks for the info on the support group. I think I'll give it a try. It's important for me to connect with others who understand what it's like to live with HIV.
I'm feeling overwhelmed with everything going on. It's a lot to process.

Can we meet up? I need someone to talk to about my health concerns. It's been a tough road since finding out about my HIV status. The diagnosis came as a complete shock, especially because I wasn't aware of the risks associated with my actions. It happened during a period when I was not as cautious as I should have been, not fully understanding the importance of protection and safe practices. I had a brief relationship where we didn't prioritize these precautions, mistakenly believing we weren't at risk.
